author: John Harney
description: As President Donald Trump begins a trip to the Middle East, the State Department on Monday approved about $1.4 billion in arms sales to the United Arab Emirates — the third Gulf state on his tour.
title: State Department Approves Arms Sales to UAE Before Trump’s Visit

author: Gregory Korte
description: President Donald Trump has always had strong opinions about the planes used as Air Force One, from their cost to their baby-blue color scheme. Frustrated with the growing costs and delays associated with Boeing Co.’s development of new presidential planes, Trump is turning to an unlikely alternative for his next ride: the Middle Eastern nation of Qatar, which plans to offer the president a luxury Boeing 747-8 jumbo jet.
title: Can Trump Accept a Plane Gifted by Qatar?

author: David Voreacos
description: Ras Baraka, the mayor of Newark, New Jersey, faces up to 30 days in jail and a $500 fine if he’s convicted of a misdemeanor charge of trespassing during a protest at a private detention facility that’s a key part of President Donald Trump’s plans for mass deportations.
title: Newark Mayor Faces 30 Days in Jail, $500 Fine Over ICE Protest

author: Diana Li
description: Li Ka-shing’s strained relationship with Beijing has sent a clear reminder to Hong Kong’s tycoons and global investors eyeing the city as a wealth hub: never downplay geopolitics.
title: Li Ka-shing’s China Clash Unnerves Rich Investors in Hong Kong

author: Simone Iglesias, Leonardo Lara, Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva insists he doesn’t want to pick between the US and China as his two largest trading partners wage a trade war. But it’s increasingly clear which side he’d choose if forced.
title: Lula and Xi to Ink New Deals as Brazil Shrugs Off Trump’s Trade Threats

author: Sabrina Willmer
description: Chief Justice John Roberts said that criticism of members of the US Supreme Court shouldn’t turn personal.
title: Chief Justice Roberts Says Court Criticism Shouldn’t Be Personal

author: Rebecca Choong Wilkins, Yang Yang, Naomi Ng
description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast: The increasingly intense conflict between India and Pakistan took a deadly turn in the last few weeks. Then the US surprised everyone by getting involved.
title: Why India and Pakistan Almost Went to War

author: Erik Wasson, Emily Birnbaum
description: House Republicans’ release of the tax provisions in their massive fiscal bill provides a crucial initial reading of what party leaders think could pass, culminating weeks of intense negotiations among fractious GOP lawmakers.
title: SALT, Tips and Auto Loans: A Guide to the House GOP Tax Bill

author: Brian Platt
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is set to unveil a new cabinet with many new faces who didn’t serve in Justin Trudeau’s inner circle, according to an official with knowledge of the matter.
title: Carney Plans Economy-Focused Cabinet With Fewer Trudeau Ministers

author: Alex Wickham, Alberto Nardelli, Ania Nussbaum
description: European leaders are ready to wait until after a possible meeting between Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and Russia’s Vladimir Putin in Turkey before pushing the US to announce fresh sanctions on Moscow, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Europe Waits for Turkey Summit to Ask Trump for Russia Sanctions

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon, Andreo Calonzo
description: Philippine voters appear to have delivered a blow to President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. and a boost to the rival Duterte clan, whose members and allies outperformed expectations in Monday’s midterm elections.
title: Dutertes Outperform in Philippine Midterms in Blow for Marcos

author: Nathan R Dean
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Bessent Gives the Bottom Line for Trump’s Tariffs After China Talks

author: Shruti Singh, Amanda Albright
description: Public finance lobbyists and bankers breathed a sigh of relief as the key federal subsidy underpinning municipal bonds appeared unscathed in a bill House tax writers released Monday.
title: Tax-Exemption on Muni Bonds ‘Untouched’ in House Tax-Cut Plan

author: Amanda Albright, Janet Lorin
description: Republican lawmakers proposed to significantly increase taxes on the richest US universities, broadening a fight between the Trump administration and elite higher education.
title: Harvard, Yale Face Major Increase to Endowment Tax in House Plan

author: Erik Wasson, Ari Natter, Nancy Cook
description: President Donald Trump’s campaign tax pledges — no taxes on tips and overtime pay, plus new tax breaks for car buyers and seniors — are the centerpiece of a multitrillion dollar package that will serve as Republicans’ signature legislative effort.
title: GOP Tax Bill Prioritizes Trump Campaign Vows, Increases SALT

author: John Tozzi
description: House Republicans revived a set of policies that would change how prescription drug middlemen do business, as President Donald Trump again denounced the industry, sending shares of some of the companies down Monday.
title: Republicans Revive Drug Middlemen Reforms in Budget Bill

author: Oscar Medina, Andrea Jaramillo
description: Fresh arrests in a sweeping Colombian corruption probe are putting President Gustavo Petro’s marquee pension reform at even greater risk of being quashed by the nation’s top judges.
title: Corruption Case Adds to Risk Court Will Nix Colombia Pension Law

author: Chris Palmeri, Thomas Buckley
description: President Donald Trump’s Hollywood ambassadors joined studios, labor unions and producers in asking the White House to expand and extend tax incentives as part of an upcoming budget reconciliation bill.
title: Jon Voight Joins Studios, Unions to Press Trump for Film Aid

author: Alessandra Migliaccio, Daniel Basteiro, Jorge Valero
description: Italy’s failure to ratify the European Stability Mechanism bailout fund leaves the bloc with less protection in case of a future banking crisis, top officials warned.
title: Italy’s ESM Refusal Adds Risk Factor, Top EU Officials Warn

author: Nduka Orjinmo
description: Lifting Nigeria’s high tariffs and import bans could significantly increase tax revenue for Africa’s most populous country, the World Bank said.
title: World Bank Sees Nigeria’s Revenues Surging If Import Bans Lifted

author: Kamil Kowalcze, Jorge Valero, Alessandra Migliaccio, Daniel Basteiro
description: A top European Union policymaker said the region should take advantage of investor doubts in the dollar and US Treasuries.
title: Market Doubts on Dollar Are Chance for EU, ESM Chief Says

author: Janet Lorin
description: Harvard University fired back at US Education Secretary Linda McMahon, denying her allegation that the school has a partisan political bias and warning that government “overreach” is threatening key freedoms.
title: Harvard Hits Back at Education Secretary McMahon, Denying Political Bias

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spanish Finance Minister Carlos Cuerpo gave the leaders of Europe’s biggest economy a vote of confidence as the region seeks ways to rekindle growth.
title: Spain’s Cuerpo Expects ‘Good Things’ From New German Government

author: Danielle Bochove, Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: The body that fosters collaboration and climate science at the top of the world is under geopolitical pressure.
title: Greenlander Takes Helm of Arctic Council as Tensions Simmer

author: Anup Roy, Sankalp Phartiyal
description: India will not hesitate to use force to neutralize terrorist camps in Pakistan as it draws a “new normal” in relations with its neighbor, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Monday.
title: Modi Says India’s Reaction Is ‘New Normal’ in Pakistan Relations

author: Alicia Clanton
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom called on cities to ban and remove homeless encampments from sidewalks, bike paths and other public property, ratcheting up the state’s effort to tackle the crisis.
title: Newsom Urges California Cities to Ban, Remove Homeless Camps

author: Alisa Odenheimer
description: Hamas freed American-Israeli hostage Edan Alexander on Monday in a hastily announced move ahead of US President Donald Trump’s visit to the Middle East.
title: Hamas Says It Released Israeli-American Hostage Edan Alexander

author: Patricia Laya, Andreina Itriago
description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro said he plans to sign up to China’s Belt and Road initiative, potentially boosting Beijing’s growing influence while further souring his relationship with the US.
title: Petro to Sign China Investment Deal as Beijing’s Influence Grows

author: Erik Wasson
description: The House tax committee’s draft bill to renew President Donald Trump’s tax cuts calls for increasing the state and local tax deduction to $30,000, but limits the write-off to those earning $400,000 or less, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: House Tax Bill Draft Calls for $30,000 SALT Deduction Limit

author: Stephanie Lai, Benedikt Kammel, Akayla Gardner
description: President Donald Trump said he would not use a luxury jet being offered by the Qatari government after leaving office amid criticism over his administration’s consideration of using the plane as the next Air Force One.
title: Trump Says He Won’t Use Qatari Jet After Leaving Office

author: Yinka Ibukun
description: Senegalese President Bassirou Diomaye Faye seeks to attract $1.7 billion of investments to build digital infrastructure and create more job opportunities for the country’s youth.
title: Senegal Seeks to Woo $1.7 Billion Investment for Digital Economy

author: Akayla Gardner
description: US President Donald Trump said he’s thinking of flying to Turkey on Thursday to join potential conversations over the war in Ukraine between Volodymyr Zelenskiy and Russia’s Vladimir Putin.
title: Trump Floats Joining Zelenskiy-Putin Talks in Turkey This Week

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: The US has welcomed European Union proposals to cooperate on mutual investments and economic security challenges, while continuing to provide little clarity on the possible outcomes of trade negotiations between the two sides, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US Said to Welcome EU Proposal to Cooperate on Economic Security

author: Colum Murphy, Fran Wang, Yujing Liu
description: Xi Jinping’s decision to stand his ground against Donald Trump could hardly have gone any better for the Chinese leader.
title: Xi Defiance Pays Off as Trump Meets Most Chinese Trade Demands

author: Akayla Gardner
description: US President Donald Trump said he would likely speak to Chinese leader Xi Jinping later this week following talks between Washington and Beijing to temporarily lower tariffs and de-escalate the trade war between the world’s two largest economies.
title: Trump Says He May Speak to Xi This Week After Tariffs Truce

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: Ex-Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte is leading in the local election in his clan’s stronghold south of the country, even as he awaits trial in the Netherlands for alleged crimes against humanity.
title: Detained Ex-Philippine President Duterte Leads in Mayoral Race

author: Ethan Bronner
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu would normally celebrate a hostage release such as that taking place on Monday, though in this case the deal with Hamas is another sign US President Donald Trump is starting to make decisions without him.
title: Trump Casts Netanyahu Adrift With Shifts on Iran, Houthis, Gaza

author: Billy House
description: House Republicans are struggling to resolve key issues with President Donald Trump’s multi-trillion dollar tax package after weekend talks, including a change in the deduction cap for state and local taxes and a potential hike in the rate for high earners.
title: GOP Starts Crucial Week With Key Tax, Spending Issues Unanswered

author: Andreo Calonzo, Neil Jerome Morales
description: Allies of Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte are outperforming in the early count for the Senate election, an unexpected setback for President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. that boosts his deputy’s chances of surviving an upcoming impeachment trial and remaining eligible to run for the presidency in 2028.
title: Sara Duterte Allies Outperform in Race for Philippine Senate

author: Reade Pickert, Mark Glassman
description: We’ve built a dashboard to help you figure out if we’re headed for a downturn.
title: The Recession Chatter Is Getting Louder. Watch These Metrics

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: President Donald Trump is attempting to implement a plan to slash drug prices for Americans by more closely aligning their costs to lower prices paid abroad.
title: Trump Wants Medicare to Pay Less Than Foreign Countries for Drugs

author: William Horobin, Kamil Kowalcze, Alessandra Migliaccio, Daniel Basteiro
description: French Finance Minister Eric Lombard welcomed the 90-day hiatus in the US-China trade war, but said more efforts are needed to de-escalate global tariff tensions.
title: France’s Lombard Wants Broader Tariff Disarmament After US-China Trade-War Reprieve

description: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg
title: Markets React to US-China Trade Truce

author: Carolina Gonzalez, Matthew Malinowski
description: Top copper miner Codelco would be able to retain more profit to help dig itself out of debt and overhaul its aging deposits if Carolina Toha wins this year’s presidential election in Chile, according to her economic spokesperson.
title: Codelco Would Keep More Profits If Carolina Toha Wins the Presidency in Chile

author: Swati Gupta
description: The most serious military confrontation between India and Pakistan in half a century appeared to be over by mid-May after the nuclear-armed neighbors agreed to a ceasefire, though tensions remained high.
title: What’s Behind the Enduring India-Pakistan Conflict?

author: Katlego Mtshali, S'thembile Cele
description: Dozens of White Afrikaners are scheduled to arrive in the US on Monday, the first beneficiaries of a controversial resettlement program instigated by President Donald Trump that his South African counterpart says is misguided.
title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Pans Trump’s Afrikaner Refugee Program

author: Alex Wickham, Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli
description: Britain and the European Union are still trying to resolve disagreements over fisheries and food checks just a week before a summit in London where Prime Minister Keir Starmer plans to announce a major reset in post-Brexit relations.
title: UK and EU Haggling Over Fish and Food Days Before Reset Summit

author: Yian Lee
description: Taiwan conducted its first live-fire test of the US-made HIMARS multiple-launch rocket systems on Monday, marking a significant step in bolstering its ability to deter a potential Chinese invasion.
title: Taiwan Conducts First Live-Fire HIMARS Test in Signal to China

author: Ania Nussbaum
description: France vowed a decisive response after Algeria announced it would expel more French embassy staff, the latest escalation in a dispute pitting the North African nation against its former colonial ruler.
title: France Vows Firm Response After Algeria Orders Embassy Staff Out

author: Richard Frost, Kiuyan Wong, Bei Hu
description: Members of Hong Kong’s financial community crowded into the Foreign Correspondents’ Club on Monday to hear the city’s most famous activist investor David Webb speak at what was labelled a “Farewell Fireside Chat.”
title: HK’s Best-Known Activist Investor Webb Addresses a Packed House

author: Rachel Adams-Heard, Polly Mosendz, Fola Akinnibi
description: Like a growing number of US communities, Torrance County, New Mexico, is convinced its financial survival depends on locking people up.
title: Trump’s Immigration Crackdown Hinges on Small Towns Hooked on Private Prisons

author: Jarrell Dillard, Nazmul Ahasan
description: There’s a growing gap between what low-income families earn and what it actually costs to live in the US, according to a new study that says headline measures of inflation fail to capture the burden on these households.
title: Low-Income US Families Face Growing Gap Between Earnings, Costs

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: The Dangers of Trump’s Quick-Fix Deals

author: Clara Hernanz Lizarraga
description: The chairman of Spain’s largest defense firm has a plan for the country to become a key player in Europe’s arms industry: build tanks.
title: Spain’s Defense Champion Indra Bets on Becoming a Tank Maker

author: Maciej Martewicz
description: Poland ordered the closure of the Russian consulate in Krakow after saying it has proof that a large fire in the country’s capital last year was ordered by Moscow’s secret services, according to the Polish foreign minister.
title: Poland to Close Another Russian Consulate Over Sabotage Claims

author: Beril Akman, Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Tens of thousands of people have been killed in the four decades since Kurdish separatist group the PKK took up arms against the Turkish government.
title: What Outlawed PKK Laying Down Arms Means for Turkey and the Kurds

author: Jenny Leonard
description: The US and China will temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products, according to a joint statement, in a move to cool trade tensions and give the world’s two largest economies three more months to resolve their differences.
title: US, China Agree to Lower Tariffs in 90-Day Cool-Off Period

author: Kamailoudini Tagba
description: Tidjane Thiam stepped down as head of Ivory Coast’s main opposition party, after his leadership was challenged in court.
title: Thiam Steps Down as Leader of Ivory Coast Opposition Party

author: Selcan Hacaoglu
description: A separatist Kurdish group agreed to lay down arms to end a 40-year war for autonomy against Turkey, a historic step that could strengthen the NATO member’s aspirations to become a regional powerhouse.
title: Kurdish Separatist Group PKK Ends 40-Year War Against Turkey

author: Ari Natter
description: US House Republicans plan to help pay for an extension of President Donald Trump’s massive tax cuts by clawing back unused funds from scores of programs and grants in his predecessor’s signature climate law.
title: US House to Claw Back Biden’s Climate Law to Fund Trump Tax Cuts

author: Ruchi Bhatia
description: A top Indian envoy said the dispute over Kashmir is a bilateral issue with Pakistan, rejecting any external mediation on the matter despite the US saying it wanted to facilitate talks.
title: India Envoy Rejects US Calls for Mediation in Kashmir Dispute

author: Gresa Kraja
description: Albania’s premier is on track to win an unprecedented fourth term as he seeks to finally take the Adriatic country into the European Union and cement its status as a tourist destination.
title: Albania’s Premier Rama on Track to Win Unprecedented Fourth Term

author: Ben Westcott
description: Australia’s Prime Minister Anthony Albanese retained Treasurer Jim Chalmers and Foreign Minister Penny Wong in their portfolios as he unveiled changes to his lineup just over a week after decisively winning an election.
title: Australia’s PM Keeps Chalmers, Wong in Roles in Second Term

author: Mia Gindis, Nathan Risser
description: Kristin Herman and her partner had been planning a European getaway with stops in Paris and Rome, but with the US economy suddenly wobbling, the couple instead drove to Oregon’s nearby redwood forests and Cannon Beach — even camping some nights to save on hotels.
title: Americans Embrace Road Trips as Economic Fears Discourage Flying

author: Sam Dagher
description: Donald Trump and Saudi Arabia's MBS both want to monetize their relationship. It just might not be in the way Trump had envisaged.
title: After Driving Down Oil, Saudi Arabia’s MBS Looks for Trump Dividend

author: Billy House, Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Erik Wasson
description: House Republicans want to impose work requirements on some Medicaid recipients up to 64 years old and impose more costs on some beneficiaries to help pay for President Donald Trump’s planned sweeping tax package.
title: Medicaid Work Requirements Sought in Bill to Fund Trump Tax Cuts

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korea’s ruling conservatives opted for a right-wing candidate in the mold of ousted leader Yoon Suk Yeol to take on frontrunner Lee Jae-myung as the official campaign for the June 3 presidential election kicked off.
title: S. Korean Conservatives Choose Right-Winger as Campaign Begins

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan won’t accept any initial trade agreement with the US that excludes auto tariffs, according to Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba.
title: Japan’s Ishiba Says Won’t Do Trade Deal With US Excluding Autos

author: Alice French
description: Shares of Asian pharmaceutical companies fell after US President Donald Trump said he planned to order a cut in US prescription drug costs to bring them in-line with other countries.
title: Asia’s Pharma Stocks Drop as Trump Plans US Drug Price Cuts
